## Description {#details}

Represents phi nodes for memory accesses.

These have the same semantic as regular phi nodes, with the exception that only one phi will ever exist in a given basic block. Guaranteeing one phi per block means guaranteeing there is only ever one valid reaching MemoryDef/MemoryPHI along each path to the phi node. This is ensured by not allowing disambiguation of the RHS of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> or a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a>&#39;s operands. That is, given if (a) &#123; store a store b &#125; it <em>must</em> be transformed into if (a) &#123; 1 = MemoryDef(liveOnEntry) store a 2 = MemoryDef(1) store b &#125; and <em>not</em> if (a) &#123; 1 = MemoryDef(liveOnEntry) store a 2 = MemoryDef(liveOnEntry) store b &#125; even if the two stores do not conflict. Otherwise, both 1 and 2 reach the end of the branch, and if there are not two phi nodes, one will be disconnected completely from the SSA graph below that point. Because <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryuse">MemoryUse</a>&#39;s do not generate new definitions, they do not have this issue.

Definition at line 478 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>.

### getIncomingBlock() {#a159e11bdff83fe6a5cf8ce8853adaac4}
